menu.name: FreeRADIUS
menu.tooltiptext: Modify FreeRADIUS macs, clients, and settings.

field.description: Enter the MAC address. Format must be: 0a-1b-2c-4d-5f-fa
The maximum of simultaneous connections with this MAC address.

Framed-IP-Address must be supported by NAS.

If you want this MAC address to be assigned a specific IP address from radius, enter the IP address here.
Continuous IP address is available with "+" suffix (e.g. 192.168.1.5+). Could be useful for simultaneous connections.

IMPORTANT: You must enter an IP address here if you checked "RADIUS issued IP" on VPN PPTP or VPN PPPoE configuration.
Framed-IP-Netmask must be supported by NAS. (e.g. 255.255.255.0)
Framed-Route must be supported by NAS. Format is: Subnet Gateway Metric (e.g. 192.168.10.0 192.168.10.1 1).

Enter the VLAN ID (integer from 1-4095) or the VLAN name that this MAC address should be assigned to.
Must be supported by the NAS.
This setting can be used for a NAS that supports the following RADIUS parameters:

Tunnel-Type = VLAN
Tunnel-Medium-Type = IEEE-802
Tunnel-Private-Group-ID = "THIS IS YOUR INPUT"
Enter the date when this account should expire. Format is: Mmm dd yyyy (e.g. Jan 01 2012).
Enter the time this MAC address has until relogin in seconds.

Enter the time when this MAC address should have access. If no time is entered it means "always".
Every time string contains a day (Mo,Tu,We,Th,Fr,Sa,Su) or all weekdays which is from monday till friday (Wk).

Wk0855-2305,Sa,Su2230-0230

This means weekdays after 8:55 AM and before 11:05 PM | any time on saturday | sunday after 10:30 PM and before 02:30 AM.
Enter the amount of time for this MAC address in seconds.
Select the time period for the amount of time.

Enter the amount of upload traffic for this MAC address in bytes. There is a bug in CaptivePortal which counts the traffic six times faster than in reality. So if a MAC address should have 1MB of traffic you must calculate 6+1MB and enter here: 6000000.
Select the time period for the amount of upload traffic.

Enter the amount of download traffic for this MAC address in bytes. There is a bug in CaptivePortal which counts the traffic six times faster than in reality. So if a MAC address should have 1MB of traffic you must calculate 6+1MB and enter here: 6000000.
Select the time period for the amount of download limit.
Enter the maximum bandwidth for download in bps (bits per second).
Enter the maximum bandwidth for upload in bps (bits per second).
Enter any description for this MAC address you like.

field.fielddescr: Additional RADIUS Attributes on the TOP of this entry
field.description:
This is for experts only and should be treat with care!
You may append custom RADIUS options to this MAC address account. If the syntax needs it, you have to set quotes and commas.
To put a command in a new line use a vertical bar (|).

Example: DEFAULT Auth-Type = System

IMPORTANT: If you don't format this field correctly freeRADIUS will not start because of syntax errors.
Verify your changes by checking authorized_macs file (View config -> macs).

You may append custom RADIUS options to this MAC address account. If the syntax needs it, you have to set quotes and commas.
To put a command in a new line use a vertical bar (|).

Example: Max-Daily-Session := 36000

IMPORTANT: If you don't format this field correctly freeRADIUS will not start because of syntax errors.
Verify your changes by checking authorized_macs file (View config -> macs).

To put a command in a new line use a vertical bar (|).

Example: Service-Type == Login-User,|Login-Service == Telnet,|Login-IP-Host == 192.168.1.2
